title: Experts Agree—These Sunscreens Are the Very Best at Protecting Acne-Prone Skin
description: Find derm-approved picks from La Roche-Posay, Supergoop, and more.
excerpt: Of all the skin care buzzwords, the most important one those with acne-prone skin should pay attention to is “non-comedogenic.” Here, ELLE.com sources the best non-comedogenic sunscreens for acne-prone skin, according to skin experts.

Best for Discoloration

La Roche-Posay Mela B3 UV Daily Sunscreen

Pros

  • Targets dark spots and hyperpigmentation

Cons

  • Finishes fairly quickly

What’s not to love about the Mela B3 sunscreen? This formula combines niacinamide and Melasyl to tackle discoloration and scarring just as well as the serum.

SPF: 30

Size: 1.6 fl oz

Key ingredients: Melasyl, niacinamide, broad-spectrum 30

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “When I saw the impressive results a fellow beauty writer had achieved with the Mela B3 serum, I was intrigued to see an accompanying SPF. It’s been weeks since I started using it, and my dark marks aren’t as pronounced as they once were. Sunscreen on its own does that, but the extra boost provided by Melasyl, which reduces dark spots and discoloration, makes the formula all the better.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Best for Brown Skin

Brownkind Sheer Sunscreen

Cons

  • Pump can be a little faulty

Designed for melanated skin tones, the Brownkind sunscreen is formulated with the brand's proprietary blend of rainbow algae, cocoa, and Indian gooseberry to encourage an even, brighter, and smoother complexion.

SPF: 40

Size

: 1 fl oz

Key ingredients

: Even tone defender (rainbow algae, cocoa, Indian gooseberry) Vitamin E

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “Vacations are when I decide to test new sunscreens, and I typically carry anywhere from two to five different formulas at a time. On a recent trip to Belize, this was the only one I remembered to bring for my face, and I used it so much I barely even missed the others at home. Perhaps it was the lightweight texture that melted into my skin with ease (and no white cast).”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Best Overall

EltaMD UV Clear Broad-Spectrum SPF 46

Cons

  • Some say it’s pricey for the bottle size

A dermatologist favorite, EltaMD’s popular sunscreen was designed with acne-prone skin in mind. “It’s lightweight, oil-free, and contains niacinamide to reduce inflammation. Plus, it’s formulated with zinc oxide to protect your skin without clogging pores, making it a perfect everyday sunscreen,” Dr. Sheila Malek Kassir explains. Sans any unnecessary ingredients that could further disrupt acneic skin, this sunscreen is built around soothing niacinamide and blends out like a dream with no evidence left behind.

SPF: 46

Size: 1.7 fl oz

Key ingredients: Niacinamide

Amazon rating: 4.6/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “This is perhaps the one sunscreen I’ve repurchased over 10 times now. Thanks to its nourishing formula packed with niacinamide, this SPF allows me to skip moisturizer some days. Plus, it blends so seamlessly with no white cast in sight.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Best Sunscreen Serum

Neutrogena Invisible Daily Defense

Now 37% Off

Cons

  • Will need to re-up frequently

Think of your favorite nourishing serum that leaves you with a subtle, non-greasy finish. Now imagine sun protection added to the mix—that’s what you get from this lightweight sunscreen. Hydrating, weightless, and a tad bit dewy, this SPF is supercharged with ginger extract and antioxidants to improve the skin’s radiance and ward off signs of aging for as long as possible. Plus, it plays well with makeup layered on top.

SPF: 60

Size: 1.7 fl oz

Key ingredients: Antioxidants, ginger extract

Amazon rating: 4.4/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “This is the sunscreen I never think twice about using. The formula is so lightweight and non-greasy that I can sometimes skip out on moisturizer and jump straight to this. Even better, it has no white cast. I love wearing it under makeup because it enhances the glow a little bit without leaving me looking too oily.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Kiehl's Better Screen UV Serum Sunscreen SPF 50+

Pros

  • Reduces the appearance of dullness

Cons

  • Many users dislike the smell

Sunscreen is an oft-forgotten soldier in the fight to slow aging. With this sunscreen by Kiehl’s, another star player is working toward the same goal: collagen peptides. This powerhouse formula not only protects against harmful rays, but brightens dark spots and visibly improves aging skin.

SPF: 50

Size: 1.7 fl oz

Key ingredients: Collagen peptides

Ulta rating: 4.7/5 stars

An Ulta reviewer says: “This is the sunscreen I have been searching for. It rubs into the skin so easily. It does not pill or leave a white cast. It’s very moisturizing as well and gives your skin a subtle glow. It does not overly burn your eyes either if some gets into them. It lays great under makeup. I spent a week in Florida and I used this daily, and my face and neck DID NOT BURN. I love this product!”

Best for Moisturizing

Dermalogica Dynamic Skin Recovery SPF50 Anti-Aging Face Sunscreen Moisturizer

Pros

  • Includes conditioning ingredients

Cons

  • Will need to reapply on long days

This formula is so creamy and lightweight, you’ll forget it’s sunscreen. Following a three-pronged approach, this sunscreen uses peptides to hydrate, moisturize, and protect the skin. Plus, it doesn’t leave a white cast and serves as a glowy base for your makeup.

SPF: 50

Size: 1.4 fl oz

Key ingredient: Polypeptides

A Dermstore rating: 5/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I love using this in place of my moisturizer because of how conditioning the ingredients feel on my skin. Not only does it blend out like a dream, it leaves no white cast and imparts a sweet radiance that makes me look way more alive than I sometimes feel.”—Nerisha Penrose, beauty commerce editor

Supergoop! Mineral Sheerscreen Sunscreen

Cons

SPF: 30

Size: 1.5 fl oz

Key ingredients: Bush clover extract, aloe leaf juice, squalane

Amazon rating: 4.1/5 stars

Our expert says: “I highly recommend this sunscreen formulated with 17.5% zinc oxide, offering effective broad-spectrum protection, while being non-comedogenic. Infused with carefully chosen moisturizing ingredients like squalane and glycerin, it hydrates without clogging pores, minimizing the risk of breakouts. Its lightweight texture absorbs quickly without leaving a white residue, despite the high mineral concentration.”—Dr Sheila Malek Kassir

SPF: 30

Size: 1.9 fl oz

Key ingredients: TriHex Technology, ectoin

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

Our expert says: “I appreciate this sunscreen as a non-comedogenic option because it contains squalane, a stable derivative of squalene, a naturally occurring lipid in the skin’s sebum. This formula is enriched with peptides that enhance skin elasticity, and its silky, easy-to-spread texture from silicone components ensures smooth application, while providing effective UV protection.”—Dr Sheila Malek Kassir

    Best for Damaged Skin

    Spending time in the sun can do wonders for your mental health, but too much exposure can actually do the opposite for your skin. Isdin’s sunscreen was designed to treat and soothe those with actinic damage, which produces rough, scaly texture and bumps following excessive sun exposure.

    Best Emollient-Rich Sunscreen

    Inside Beauty Emollient Sunscreen

    Chances are, if you have oily or acne-prone skin, you’ve steered clear of emollient-rich formulas out of fear they’ll clog your pores even more. This favorite of Dr. Sheila Malek Kassir will change your mind. The light, thin texture absorbs into the skin with ease, imparting Vitamins C and E, as well as ferulic acid.

    SPF: 40

    Size: 1.75 fl oz

    Key ingredients: Vitamins C and E, ferulic acid

    Our expert says: “This is perfect if you have dry or combination skin. It offers broad-spectrum protection and is packed with antioxidants like Vitamin C and Vitamin E. The lightweight, non-greasy texture absorbs quickly, leaving a silky finish—no clogged pores here!”—Dr.Sheila Malek Kassir

    Meet the Expert

    Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

    What ingredients should you look for in a non-comedogenic sunscreen?

    Shopping for sunscreen requires just as much care and attention as shopping for cleansers, serums, or moisturizers. According to Dr. Kassir, it’s important to prioritize “lightweight, oil-free, and mineral-based formulas.” Here are a few ingredients Dr. Kassir says to look out for:

    Zinc Oxide: Found on the label of every sunscreen, zinc oxide “is a physical sun blocker that sits on top of your skin, reflecting harmful UV rays. It’s especially good for sensitive or acne-prone skin since it doesn’t clog pores.”

    Titanium Dioxide: “Another gentle, physical blocker that’s great for keeping your skin protected without causing breakouts.”

    Niacinamide: “Known for its soothing and anti-inflammatory properties, niacinamide helps control oil production, reducing the risk of clogged pores.”

    Hyaluronic Acid: “This is a great hydrating ingredient that works without adding heavy oils, which makes it perfect for those prone to breakouts.”

    What ingredients should you stay away from? 

    The heavier the ingredient (like certain oils), the more damaging it could be for your pores. “Avoid sunscreens that contain soybean oil, almond oil, and avocado oil, which tend to have a high oleic acid profile associated with higher comedogenicity. Furthermore, the synthetic oil isopropyl myristate, as well as lanolin or any of its derivatives, should also be avoided, as these ingredients can clog pores and trigger breakouts,” Dr. Khelemsky explains.
